summary: The Transportation Emergency Relief Extension Act (S. 2635) aims to amend Title 23 of the United States Code to provide increased flexibility for emergency relief projects related to transportation. It extends deadlines for advancing projects to the construction obligation stage, allows for extensions at the request of state governors, and mandates the regular updating of the Federal Highway Administration's Emergency Relief Manual. This bill directly addresses how funds are distributed and timelines for projects related to urgent repairs following natural disasters or other emergencies.
